comments.body: I hate to be that one person who finds flaws in your hard-worked ideas, and don't get me wrong, this does sound like a good idea, but having them drop prismarine shards would subtract from the lore, because they only come from guardians (or prismarine blocks) BECAUSE guardians are made of that kind of rock and are not organic. So having a living creature drop the mineral wouldn't really make sense because they don't have anything do do with it. (:

Having them drop Prismarine Shards wouldn't make much sense, but I do want them to drop Prismarine Crystals as I believe those are the part that actually glows. Sea Lanterns are made with the Crystals, whereas the regular Prismarine blocks only use the Shards.

Plus, if they drop the Crystals instead of Shards, it means players still need to find an Ocean Monument to acquire Prismarine Blocks and build the Conduit, which I think is important and should stay that way.
Should make their drops interesting , where are the people who voted for this thing , we need atleast something of a loot from them rather than plain old ink sacs.
make a new variant of the glow squid called the stellar squid and added it to the game please I'm begging you and also add the deer like mob into the game please Minecraft I'm begging you
This would be so cool. I think these spiders would be a bit more passive rather than aggressive.
That's a really good idea, and it wouldn't be a inherently aggressive mob, love it
I like it but..... the lush caves are supposed to be peaceful so mabye make it a passive mob
it could be a spider smaller than the cave spider even, disguised as a drip leaf, or a small leaf. They wouldn't do much damage, maybe half heart or a couple, but i think they'd be really cute :33

Maybe they could plant themselves into the ground and when the player travels near the biome they uproot and maybe they could be searching for an enderman to turn into a twisted ender men one of my ideas  posted it awhile ago
I think that the warped forest should feel kind of empty since it is a great contrast to the crimson forest. However, I like the idea of this mob so I voted for it anyway.

Tetras, catfish, danios and loaches might also be interesting freshwater fish, to add, maybe even ones that attack you if you attack them like gar, pike and other monster fish species, but that you can still collect just like other fish

I've been mulling this one over too, but I think the texture should be like skeleton pirates. They can be any skeleton that meets the drowned conditions, but they should also spawn around shipwrecks.
I would like for it to be called "decayed drowned" and use a melee attack rather than a bow. The bow would be rotten and unusable. Give it algae in the ribs and whatnot.
A skeleton can't drown.
That would be a very playful explanarion to what happens when a drowned or skeleton stays in the deep water for too long...

I feel like that would be SO COOL, but if I can make a suggestion. I feel like it would be great if they spawned near a ship wreck. It would make sense why they spawned there. But it's just a suggestion.

Moon feather can be combined with elytra at blacksmith table to make Moon elytra (needs better title) and is combo between iron chestplate and elytra and can have protection
This is a great idea for a boss. Its a very creative way to make sure players probably won't accidentally engage the boss. Also an overworld boss is overdue. Good suggestion.

I love this boss idea! I think you've balanced it pretty well too! One thing... It seems like disabling elytra would be very OP and annoying. Just a thought. It also shouldn't follow a player to the ground, because that would make it just a normal fight. I like the idea of it spiraling to the ground when you defeat it, and I think it would be cool if it was screaming and spewing xp the whole way down. And the moon feather... what if when you held it, you could jump boost into the air really big? I'm thinking like a rocket with an elytra, but you get to use a feather to have an easy take-off. Just a thought. It should provide some kind of epic elytra upgrade/boost/thing though.
Cool idea. Would it trap monsters or animals?
Sounds like a venus fly trap for people

I like the idea, but I think the design should be a little different.

Instead of being a completely flat mob, I feel it should be a full block size, like the shulker. And instead of being textured like grass, it should look like leaves. that way it'll blend in with the foliage all over the ground.
So it is basically a more dangerous version of a Plant Species Y.
@Zinc shepherd the whole point of it is to be a trap not something like a shulker
I think this is needed for bane of arthropods to be expanded on. Also, you have a good point with so many zombie variants there should also be spider variants.

It appears there is a similar topic on this idea already being talked about! Help your ideas make it into Minecraft and join existing threads in progress, even if your idea isn't an exact match - we read ALL the comments. Don't forget to upvote good comments!

When struck by lightning a pig would turn into a Zombie Pigman because It just doesn't make sense for it to turn into a Piglin.... The Piglins resemble the Hoglins and the Pigmen resemble pigs so why would a pig turn into a Piglin. This should stay as it was and like that we get to keep our beloved Pigman.
Maybe make it so you can only attack it with a pickaxe, since it's a fossil. Or maybe it would spawn in place of ancient debris in some chunks? Just, buff it, because ancient debris is op

New Zombidfied Piglin is very good, but old Zombie Pigman is classic. Overworld Pig has a normal head. Old Zombie Pigman should still spawns when lightning strikes within 4 blocks of a pig.
But no with the golden sword.

This could also be involved with the lore of the Totem of Undying.

I also agree that Netherite is OP and is far too easy to get. Having Ancient Pigman guarding it would make hunting down scraps so much harder.
Until you die, and reversible, this way they do not always hate you.

Possibilities for higher respect:

- Piglins that respect you may actually allow you to open chests and stuff- of course, if you take their gold... they should still attack you...

- Piglins that respect you may actually allow you to store some measure of gold- provided you use a shulker box or enderchest as otherwise they'll suspect you of stealing and attack you...

- Piglins that respect you may actually ally themselves with you and come to your defense... especially if you're attacked by a wither skeleton...

- Piglins that respect you may actually allow you to approach without gold armor- they'll know you have it, so even if they don't see it, they won't use you as target practice...

Possibilities for lower respect:

- Piglins that don't respect you will be sure to attack you even if you wear a full set of gold armor- they just know you're up to no good, and that you probably stole whatever gold armor you have on you...

This is such a good idea!! And for jumping since it can be hard to find a good jumper
Yeah. I think this would be really cool. You could have to train the horse. They could start out with only a walking speed, and you can train them, just like in real life!

Love this!! Have been trying for a while to get more details for the horse. I think this would be great! I love building horse ranches in the game, but it really sucks to have to breed to get good jumpers or fast runners. I think training would work something like this:

*Jumping*
-Everytime you jump the horse they get better and can jump higher.
-They become easier to turn if you ride them more, and turn them a lot.

*Racing*
-The horses get faster the more you ride them. Maybe every 15 mins or so, you get a notification that "horse" or whatever the name is "has leveled up" (or maybe not if that would be too annoying)

*if you don't ride your horse for a while, then the stats start to wear off*
Also, along with this, horses should only be able to run for so long before getting "tired" and going super slow. They will only recover if fed and they go for 10 minutes without riding. This would help players have more of a challenge when moving from place to place, and to think for their animals and themselves.
They could add this along side the swamp update wen they add the frogs. Colorful frogs in jungles, sounds amazing!
Use them to tip arrows! Not to put too fine a point on it...

I think this is a great idea and will probably  make a huge impact to Minecraft.The frogs will match the swamp biome.I think frogs should be added to the game and the majority of Minecraft users would love to see frogs especially poison dart frogs.

I don't think It's combat prowess isn't really a problem, but it definitely feels weak to raiders and such because it can't really get into combat with mobs very easily. It's too slow to protect the villagers. The dash attack would definitely alleviate this problem a little by giving it small bursts of speed.

Another solution is to give them an ability that causes mobs in a certain radius to target the iron golem rather than any nearby villagers. A "Taunt" if you will. This works double for protecting villagers and helping the iron golem deal with the raiders by attracting them to him rather than having to get to them himself. Perhaps being immune to knockback and/or being more resistant to arrows would help against the crossbow-wielding illagers, or that could just be their advantage.

Nice ideas bro i'll come to add these others

--Attacks:

-Punch: Normal strike using one of it's fists.[Small damage and knockback, fast cooldown]

-Slam:Grab a enemy smaller than them then they strike them on the floor stunning them for 1 sec. [Medium Damage,No knockback, medium cooldown]

-Dual Hammer: The golem using it's two hands striking the enemy and sending to the air with a height of 4 to 6 blocks making this a hit where this benefits of the fall damage.(This one will replace the actual one in game)[Medium damage, no knockback, high elevation, slow cooldown]
